data.title: Nicos Anastasiades – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Latest news from POLITICO about Nicos Anastasiades
data.text:
Cyprus set for second coronavirus lockdown

Business to close and permission to go out needs approval.

Peace activists see hopes for unified Cyprus fading

Coronavirus, tensions with Turkey and the election of a hardliner have dampened prospects for reunification.

Ghost town reopening in Northern Cyprus sparks fears of Turkish election interference

The reopening of Varosha also risks derailing reunification talks on divided island, critics say.

Rough seas for NATO as Turkey clashes with allies

Macron sees vindication in tensions with Ankara over Libya.

Cypriot president: ‘Aggressive’ Turkey should be stripped of EU candidate status

Nicos Anastasiades says reunification talks can restart if Ankara steps back its energy exploration plans.

EU leaders to Europe on Europe Day: We’re Number 1

In video message, 30 leaders celebrate their Union and vow to overcome coronavirus pandemic.

Turkey’s Mediterranean claims lead to EU spat

A Turkish-Libyan maritime border deal has enraged Greece and Cyprus.

Cyprus nominates Stella Kyriakides for commissioner post

Nicosia is one of a handful of governments to have nominated a woman for the next Commission.

Turkey to ramp up EastMed drilling in response to EU sanctions

EU foreign ministers unanimously approved an initial series of measures against Turkey over Ankara’s exploration efforts off the coast of Cyprus on Monday.

Merkel’s alliance first in EU election, Greens make big gains

Early results also predict strong showing for Austria’s chancellor after scandal enveloped coalition partner.

EU warns Turkey over oil drilling in Cypriot waters

Greece and Cyprus urged EU to address alleged Turkish violation of exclusive economic zone.

Cyprus justice minister resigns amid serial killer protests

Island police criticized for lax handling of alleged serial killer’s crimes.

The Brexit playbook in the 11 EU countries that will shape a deal

Domestic politics will play an increasingly important role in what kind of future relationship the bloc will agree to.

Cypriot President Nicos Anastasiades wins second term

Greek Cypriots vote for leader who guided country into economic recovery.

Cyprus’ Anastasiades heads to runoff with center-left rival

Incumbent president faces second round of voting next Sunday.

Cyprus deal revival hangs on election

The three front-runners all say they’re in favor of returning to peace talks, but their enthusiasm and terms vary widely.

Two votes, one last chance for Cypriot reunification

Reviving peace talks would require serious political will to go back to a deal left on the table last year.

Cypriots look to UN chief to lead them to reunification

António Guterres is the ‘man among boys’ in the last phase of negotiations for a Cypriot settlement.

Sun setting on chances of Cyprus deal

Things will only get harder if talks in Switzerland don’t lead to an agreement on reunification.

Cyprus re-unification talks back on in Geneva

UN Secretary-General António Guterres brokered the deal over a four-hour dinner in New York.

Cyprus reunification at an impasse as UN fails to find compromise

Onus now firmly back on Turkish and Greek Cypriot leaders.

UN says Cyprus peace talks deadlocked

Reunification talks have stalled since February.

Cyprus united … over Erdoğan

With time running short, Cyprus needs a strong, secure Turkish president to back a deal to reunify the island.
